sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"读，阅读"之意。
means: read ： 最普通用词，含义广泛。既指朗读又可指默读。
devor ： 指贪婪地读，暗含对某些作者或作品迷恋之义。
scan ： 指快速扫视文章等以抓住其要旨。

sentence.Network_en: I thought you might like to read the enclosed.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想你或许想要读一下信封里的内容。

sentence.Network_en: In her spare time she read books on cooking.
sentence.Network_cn: 业余时间里她看一些烹饪方面的书籍。

sentence.Network_en: When the decision was read out Mrs Gardner thanked the judges.
sentence.Network_cn: 判决书宣读完，加德纳夫人向法官们表示感谢。

lj.lj_ly: Please read out the names on the list.
lj.lj_ls: 请大声念出名单上的名字

jx.jx_en_mean: To study or learn by reading
jx.jx_cn_mean: 研读：通过阅读进行研究或学习

lj.lj_ly: Read up on the places you plan to visit before you travel.
lj.lj_ls: 在旅游之前，对你准备前往的地方先作一番调查研究

jx.jx_en_mean: understand someone's thoughts and motives clearly or easily
jx.jx_cn_mean: 了解…的心思（或动机）；对…了如指掌
猜透…的心思，知道…在想些什么

jx.jx_en_mean: (N. Amer. informal)listen carefully (used to emphasize the importance of the speaker's words or the earnestness of their intent)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)请认真听（用来强调所说的话的重要性或表达说话人迫切的心情）

jx.jx_en_mean: assume something without the need for further discussion
(Austral./NZ informal)used to express incredulity, disgust, or ruefulness
jx.jx_cn_mean: (澳/新西兰，非正式)太离奇了（用来表示怀疑、厌恶、悲伤）

jx.jx_en_mean: read a message or piece of writing aloud so that its accuracy can be checked
jx.jx_cn_mean: 朗读信息（或书面材料）（以检验其准确性）；重念，复述

jx.jx_en_mean: attribute a meaning or significance to (something) that it may not in fact possess
jx.jx_cn_mean: 把…加进对…的理解中去；对…做某种解释

lj.lj_ly: was I reading too much into his behaviour?.
lj.lj_ls: 我是否对他的行为做了过于武断的解释？。

jx.jx_en_mean: (chiefly US)formally expel someone from (an organization or body)

phrase.cizu_name: read up on something (或 read something up)

jx.jx_en_mean: acquire information about a particular subject by studying it intensively or systematically
jx.jx_cn_mean: 研读，攻读；系统地研究（某一科目）

lj.lj_ly: she spent the time reading up on antenatal care.
lj.lj_ls: 她投入时间系统研究产前保健问题。

lj.lj_ly: Mother read us a lecture after the principal telephoned her.
lj.lj_ls: 校长打电话后，妈妈批评了我们一顿

phrase.cizu_name: read a lecture 或 read a lesson

jx.jx_en_mean: To perceive or detect an obscure or unexpressed meaning
jx.jx_cn_mean: 仔细阅读，研究：找出或发现隐藏晦涩的意思

lj.lj_ly: learned to read between the lines of corporate annual reports to discern areas of fiscal weakness.
lj.lj_ls: 学会仔细研读公司年度报告，并从中发现财政困难的迹象

jx.jx_en_mean: To expel by proclamation from a social, political, or other group
jx.jx_cn_mean: 驱逐，开除：被正式文告从社会、政治或其它集团中驱逐

lj.lj_ly: He was read out of the secretariat after the embarrassing incident.
lj.lj_ls: 由于那次尴尬的事件，他被从秘书处开除了

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English rǣdan, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch raden and German raten 'advise, guess'. Early senses included 'advise' and 'interpret (a riddle or dream') (see rede)

encyclopedia.content: 英语单词，在汉语中有多种译法和解释，同时又是机算机语言函数和命令，用在不同的位置有不同的译法、解释及作用，应视情而定。

entry.def: When you read something such as a book or article, you look at and understand the words that are written there.

example.ex: Have you read this book?...
example.tran: 你看过这本书吗？

example.ex: I read about it in the paper...
example.tran: 我在报纸上看到了这件事。

entry.def: When you read a piece of writing to someone, you say the words aloud.

example.ex: Jay reads poetry so beautifully...
example.tran: 杰伊朗读诗歌很动听。

example.ex: I like it when she reads to us...
example.tran: 我很喜欢她读书给我们听。

entry.def: People who can read have the ability to look at and understand written words.

example.ex: He couldn't read or write...
example.tran: 他不会读写。

example.ex: He could read words at 18 months.
example.tran: 他18个月大的时候就认字了。

entry.def: If you can read music, you have the ability to look at and understand the symbols that are used in written music to represent musical sounds.

example.ex: Later on I learned how to read music.
example.tran: 后来我学会了怎么识乐谱。

entry.def: When a computer reads a file or a document, it takes information from a disk or tape.

example.ex: How can I read a Microsoft Excel file on a computer that only has Works installed?
example.tran: 我怎样在只安装了Works软件的电脑上读取微软的Excel文件呢？

entry.def: You can use read when saying what is written on something or in something. For example, if a notice reads 'Entrance', the word 'Entrance' is written on it.

example.ex: The sign on the bus read 'Private: Not In Service'.
example.tran: 巴士的标牌上写着“私家车：不对外出租”。

entry.def: If you refer to how a piece of writing reads, you are referring to its style.

example.ex: The book reads like a ballad...
example.tran: 这本书读起来像歌谣。

example.ex: It reads very awkwardly.
example.tran: 它读起来很拗口。

entry.tran: 令人愉快的读物；好书（或杂志）
entry.def: If you say that a book or magazine is a good read, you mean that it is very enjoyable to read.

example.ex: Ben Okri's latest novel is a good read.
example.tran: 本·奥克里的最新小说很精彩。

entry.def: If something is read in a particular way, it is understood or interpreted in that way.

example.ex: The play is being widely read as an allegory of imperialist conquest...
example.tran: 这部剧被广泛解读为对帝国主义征服的讽喻。

example.ex: South Africans were praying last night that he has read the situation correctly...
example.tran: 昨晚南非人在祈祷他对形势的解读是正确的。

entry.tran: 看得出，读懂，看透（想法或心思）
entry.def: If you read someone's mind or thoughts, you know exactly what they are thinking without them telling you.

example.ex: As if he could read her thoughts, Benny said, 'You're free to go any time you like.'
example.tran: 班尼仿佛看出了她的心思，说道：“你随时都可以自由离开。”

entry.def: If you can read someone or you can read their gestures, you can understand what they are thinking or feeling by the way they behave or the things they say.

example.ex: If you have to work in a team you must learn to read people...
example.tran: 如果要在一个团队中工作你必须学会了解他人。

example.ex: Under the shaded light her expression was difficult to read.
example.tran: 她的表情隐在阴影中，很难读懂。

entry.def: If someone who is trying to talk to you with a radio transmitter says, 'Do you read me?', they are asking you if you can hear them.

example.ex: Alpha-Bravo-Zulu 643 to Saltezar, do you read me? Over...
example.tran: 阿尔法－布拉沃－祖鲁643呼叫萨德扎，能听到我的声音吗？完毕。

example.ex: We read you loud and clear. Over.
example.tran: 我们能够清楚地听到你的声音。完毕。

entry.tran: 读（表）；记下（仪表上的数字）
entry.def: When you read a measuring device, you look at it to see what the figure or measurement on it is.

example.ex: When officials like gas and electricity men call to read the meter, ask for identification...
example.tran: 当有燃气或电力公司的职员来抄表时，要请他们出示身份证件。

example.ex: It is essential that you are able to read a thermometer.
example.tran: 最基本的是要能看懂温度计。

entry.def: If a measuring device reads a particular amount, it shows that amount.

example.ex: The thermometer read 105 degrees Fahrenheit...
example.tran: 温度计显示华氏105度。

example.ex: The fuel gauge reads below zero.
example.tran: 燃油表显示油量在零以下。

entry.def: If you read a subject at university, you study it.

example.ex: She read French and German at Cambridge University...
example.tran: 她在剑桥大学学习法语和德语。

example.ex: He is now reading for a maths degree at Surrey University.
example.tran: 他现在就读于萨里大学，攻读数学学位。

entry.def: If you take something as read, you accept it as true or right and therefore feel that it does not need to be discussed or proved.

example.ex: We took it as read that he must have been a KGB agent...
example.tran: 我们完全相信他曾经是一名克格勃特工。

example.ex: The case for aid to eastern Europe is taken as read.
example.tran: 援助东欧的主张被认为完全正确。

sentences.sentence: "the article was a very good read"

means.word_mean: 1. interpret something that is written or printed;
2. have or contain a certain wording or form;
3. look at, interpret, and say out loud something that is written or printed;

sentences.sentence: "The King will read the proclamation at noon"
"This dictionary can be read by the computer"

means.word_mean: 5. interpret the significance of, as of palms, tea leaves, intestines, the sky, etc.; also of human behavior;

sentences.sentence: "She read the sky and predicted rain"
"The gypsy read his fate in the crystal ball"

means.word_mean: 6. interpret something in a certain way; convey a particular meaning or impression;

sentences.sentence: "I read this address as a satire"

means.word_mean: 7. indicate a certain reading; of gauges and instruments;

sentences.sentence: "The thermometer showed thirteen degrees below zero"

means.word_mean: 8. be a student of a certain subject;

sentences.sentence: "She is reading for the bar exam"

means.word_mean: 9. audition for a stage role by reading parts of a role;

sentences.sentence: "He is auditioning for `Julius Cesar' at Stratford this year"

sentences.en: The little boy can read quite well now.
sentences.cn: 这个小男孩的阅读能力相当不错了。

sentences.en: He read Shakespeare to help his English.
sentences.cn: 他阅读莎士比亚的作品以提高自己的英语水平。
这钟显示的时间是4点20分。

jushi.english: I have little time to read.
I have been reading the whole morning.
